Title: Vietnam’s PV Gas seeks one prompt June LNG cargo
Description: State-owned PetroVietnam Gas, or PV Gas, has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery in June to its 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG receiving terminal. The tender closes on May 16.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt looks to secure fifth FSRU this year
Description: Egypt is seeking a long-term charter of a fifth floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) to boost imports further.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global asks FERC to expedite approval of CP2
Description: LNG project developer Venture Global has asked the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to expedite the reauthorisation of its proposed CP2 LNG export project in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: NFE plans Altamira FLNG outage in coming weeks to debottleneck and boost output
Description: New Fortress Energy plans to take its 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG terminal in Mexico offline in the coming weeks to carry out debottlenecking work aimed at significantly increasing production.
Author: CK

Title: New Fortress Energy eyes two more  FSRU sub-charters
Description: New Fortress Energy is preparing to sign two additional sub-charters for floating storage and regasification units as part of its strategy to monetize vessels surplus to its needs to generate additional cash flow.
Author: CK

Title: Aramco advances US LNG offtake deals with Sempra, NextDecade
Description: Saudi Arabia’s Aramco has taken further steps toward securing long-term US LNG supply, advancing a heads of agreement with Sempra Infrastructure through a new memorandum of understanding, and finalising a 20-year offtake agreement with NextDecade. Together, these deals commit Aramco to a combined LNG offtake volume of 6.2 mtpa The agreements build on previously announced deals and underscore Aramco’s strong interest in US LNG.
Author: CK
